info.title: User Management System API
info.description: "User Management System API. Note: most errors have a message and a status field in the response body, but SwaggerUI won't show it (open issue in swagger-ui)"

JWT.description:
For accessing the API a valid JWT token must be passed in all the queries in the 'Authorization' header.


A valid JWT token is generated by the API and returned as answer of a call to the route /authenticate giving a valid user & password.


The following syntax must be used in the 'Authorization' header :

    JWT xxxxxx.yyyyyyy.zzzzzz
JWT.name: Authorization

AWS.description: AWS API Key for development enviroment
AWS.name: x-api-key

post.description: Authenticates active user

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: userName and password to be used in the authentication process

post.description: Authenticates active user

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: userName and password to be used in the authentication process

post.description: Verifies user e-mail and if e-mail is valid, activate user and set userName and passname

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body contains the user e-mail to be verified and the verificationCode, which corresponds to the authToken in the user model; the userName to be set; the password; and user uid.

post.description: Requests a password change. An e-mail with instructions on how to change the password will be sent to the configured user e-mail

parameters.name: Send-Email
parameters.description: Indicates whether an actual email should be sent or not. For security reasons the default behavior is to not send any email.

parameters.name: Return-Verification-Code
parameters.description: Indicates whether the user verification code should be returned or not. For security reasons the default behavior is to not return it.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body should have the e-mail or userName of the user that forgot his password

200.description: E-mail with password change information sent successfully

post.description: Changes user password to a new password provided in the request body

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body must always contains the new password field. The uid or e-mail to identify the user is only necessary for LdapUsers trying to change some other user password, or for UMS users that are logged off, in this case it should only contain the verification code (uid and e-mail will be ignored).

get.description: Return a new Json Web Token with a refreshed expiration time
Return the JWT internal payload if it's a valide (and not expired) UMS token

post.description: Return a flag indicating if e-mails is valid (not used yet) or invalid.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body must contain the e-mail to be validated, in other words, an e-mail that uniqueness will be verified.

post.description: Returns a flag indicating if the username is valid and another flag indicating if the username was not used yet

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body must contain the username to be validated

post.description: Creates a new User passing user data. Not all user model fields are required, check its description for reference

parameters.name: Send-Email
parameters.description: Indicates whether an actual email should be sent or not. For security reasons the default behavior is to not send any email.

parameters.name: Return-Verification-Code
parameters.description: Indicates whether the user verification code should be returned or not. For security reasons the default behavior is to not return it.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body is a JSON describing the user to be created

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: User application UID. It's not implemented yet!

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: User organization UID. It's not implemented yet!

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: User status Check "Try Out" for options Select more than one by holding ctrl

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Filter user list by firstName Example: firstName=Pedro|Flavio This will get all users with Pedro or Flavio as the first name

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Filter user list by lastName Example: lastName=Oliveira|Santos This will get all users with Oliveira or Santos as the last name

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Filter user list by userName Example: userName=Pedro123|Flavio345 This will get the users with Pedro123 or Flavio345 as the userName

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Filter user list by email Example: email=admin@nrccuaorg|user@nrccuaorg This will get the users with admin@nrccuaorg or user@nrccuaorg as the email

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter user list by type Example: type=LdapUser

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the data to be returned

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: If marked as true UMS will return a simple version of each object (without joins or aggregations), defaults to false

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Indicate the field used to order the resulting list Example: fieldOne,fieldTwo(desc) This will return the list sorted by fieldOne (ascending, the default) and then by fieldTwi (descending)

total-count.description: Total of possible searches to be returned (excluding limit and offset)

prev-offset.description: Offset value to go back one page

next-offset.description: Offset value to go foward one page

head.summary: Gets the header of the list of user

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: User application UID. It's not implemented yet!

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: User organization UID. It's not implemented yet!

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: User status Check "Try Out" for options Select more than one by holding ctrl

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Filter user list by firstName Example: firstName=Pedro|Flavio This will get all users with Pedro or Flavio as the first name and return their metadata in the header

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Filter user list by lastName Example: lastName=Oliveira|Santos This will get all users with Oliveira or Santos as the last name and return their metadata in the header

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: Filter user list by userName Example: userName=Pedro123|Flavio345 This will get the users with Pedro123 or Flavio345 as the userName and return their metadata in the header

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Filter user list by email Example: email=admin@nrccuaorg|user@nrccuaorg This will get the users with admin@nrccuaorg or user@nrccuaorg as the email and return their metadata in the header

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size limit for data used to generate the metadata

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the data used to generate the metadata

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: If marked as true UMS will return a simple version of each object (without joins or aggregations), defaults to false

200.description: The header of users along with their metadata

total-count.description: Total of possible searches to be returned (excluding limit and offset)

prev-offset.description: Offset value to go back one page

next-offset.description: Offset value to go foward one page

get.description: Returns a single user by its UID

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: If marked as true UMS will return a simple version of the User object, defaults to false

put.summary: Updates an user
put.description: Updates user identified by UID. Parameters to be updated are provided in the requested body and correspond to the fields described in user model. Valid user fields not shown in the model will be ignored in update (createAt, lastUpdated, ...) All parameters are optional, but at least one parameter must be provided in the request body for the request to succeed. The UID field can be provided but must match the one provided in path

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Fields and values to be updated

delete.description: Sets an user as inactive in the database

get.summary: Checks if user has a permission for module
Checks if user has a permission for application

get.description: Returns the attributes from an user by its UID

put.summary: Creates or updates an user attribute in batch
put.description: Creates or updates the user attributes with a batch operation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body contains an array of attributes to be created or updated

200.description: The operation result and current attribute array

delete.summary: Deletes an user attributes in batch
delete.description: Delete multiple user attributes with a batch operation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body contains an array of attributes to be deleted

200.description: The operation result and current attribute array

get.description: Returns the keys from user attributes
Returns the attributes from an user by its key

put.summary: Creates or updates an user attribute
put.description: Creates or updates an attribute from the user's attributes array by the user's UID in the path and the attribute key and value in the body If the key is not present in the array, the attribute is created, if the key is present the attribute is updated

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body contains an attribute entry to be created or updated

200.description: The operation result and current attribute array

delete.description: Deletes an attribute from the user's attributes array by the user's UID in the path and the attribute key in the body

200.description: The operation result and current attribute array

Returns the modifications from an user by its UID
Returns the login history from an user by its UID

post.description: Impersonates a user by its UID

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: User UID of the user you want to impersonate

delete.description: Stops impersonating an user by its UID and JWT payload. JWT should be the same as the one created in the POST impersonate route. An JWT obtained from the login route won't work on this route

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: User UID of the user you want to stop impersonating (should match payload)

get.description: Returns the impersonate history from an user by its UID

post.description: Sends an email to activate or invite a user again

parameters.name: Send-Email
parameters.description: Indicates whether an actual email should be sent or not. For security reasons the default behavior is to not send any email.

parameters.name: Return-Verification-Code
parameters.description: Indicates whether the user verification code should be returned or not. For security reasons the default behavior is to not return it.

post.description: Creates a new organization passing organization data Not all organization model fields are required, check its description for reference

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body is itself a JSON describing the organization to be created

400.description: Missing field at request body or wrong fields

get.description: Gets a list of organizations Query parameters can be provided to filter the returned organizations

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Organization status Check "Try it out" for possible options

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter organizations list by name Example: name=Org1|Org2 This will get all organizations with Org1 or Org2 as the name

parameters.name: sfAccountId
parameters.description: Filter organizations list by sfAccountId Example: sfAccountId=0016000000ImzzJAAR|0017000019ImzzJBAR This will get all organizations with those sfAccountIds

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Filter organizations list by externalId Example: externalId=003422 This will get all organizations with those externalId (FICE)

parameters.name: actCode
parameters.description: Filter organizations list by actCode Example: actCode=0028 This will get all organizations with those Act College Codes

parameters.name: orgType
parameters.description: Filter organizations list by type Example: orgType=Organization This will get all organizations with type = Organization

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter organizations list by type Example: type=Business This will get all organizations with orgType field pointing to an organization named 'Business'

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the data to be returned

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: If marked as true UMS will return a simple version of each object (without joins or aggregations), defaults to false

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Indicate the field used to order the resulting list Example: fieldOne,fieldTwo(desc) This will return the list sorted by fieldOne (ascending, the default) and then by fieldTwi (descending)

total-count.description: Total of possible searches to be returned (excluding limit and offset)

prev-offset.description: Offset value to go back one page

next-offset.description: Offset value to go foward one page

parameters.name: type

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size limit for data used to generate the metadata

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the data used to generate the metadata

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: If marked as true UMS will return a simple version of each object (without joins or aggregations), defaults to false

get.summary: Finds organization by UID, name, externalId (FICE) or actCode
get.description: Returns an organization by the provided UID, organization Name, externalId (FICE) or Act College Code.

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: UID of the organization to be returned (name, externalId (FICE) or Act College Code can also be used)

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: If marked as true UMS will return a simple version of the Organization object, defaults to false

put.summary: Updates an organization
put.description: Updates organization identified by UID Parameters to be updated are provided in the requested body and correspond to the fields described in organization model All fields are optional, but at least one should be provided in the body

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: UID of the organization to be modified

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Fields and values to be updated

parameters.name: moduleUid
parameters.description: Module uid Example: ef34d669-8061-4131-84d3-d7e508d784fd or Module key Example: datalab.classplanner

parameters.description: Filter organization-application relationships list by organizationUid Example: organizationUid=44bc5658-e923-4c0b-9400-c638eabef494 This will get all organization-application relationships with organizationUid equals to 44bc5658-e923-4c0b-9400-c638eabef494

parameters.name: applicationUid
parameters.description: Filter organization-application relationships list by applicationUid Example: applicationUid=44bc5658-e923-4c0b-9400-c638eabef494 This will get all organization-application relationships with applicationUid equals to 44bc5658-e923-4c0b-9400-c638eabef494

parameters.description: Filter User by status. Example status=Active|Pending

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter User by status. Example type=User|LdapUser

parameters.description: Filter users list by searchStr Example: searchStr=Abbott This will get all users with Abbott at some important field (firstName, lastName, userName, etc )

parameters.description: List of user fields to ignore on search when passing searchStr parameter Example: ignore=firstName|lastName This will limit the search to userName or email
